generalInfo:
This 4-day tour highlights the natural beauty and ecological richness of Santa Cruz Island in the Galapagos. You’ll explore the world-renowned Charles Darwin Research Station, where giant tortoises are part of important conservation efforts, and gain insight into the unique biodiversity of the archipelago.

Highland excursions on Santa Cruz will take you through lush vegetation and volcanic landscapes, where you may encounter iconic species like land iguanas, Darwin’s finches, and the famous giant tortoises in their natural environment.
Your journey continues with day trips to Bartolome and North Seymour, two nearby islands known for their dramatic scenery and abundant wildlife. On Bartolome, admire its iconic pinnacle rock and panoramic views. On North Seymour, walk among blue-footed boobies, frigatebirds, and playful sea lions in one of the best wildlife observation spots in the Galapagos.


This itinerary is perfect for nature lovers seeking an immersive experience. It offers a balanced combination of land and marine exploration, close encounters with endemic wildlife, and the chance to witness some of the most breathtaking views the Galapagos has to offer.

dayInfo.description: Quito/Guayaquil - Baltra - Puerto Ayora. Fly from Quito, Guayaquil or Quito to Baltra airport. A naturalist guide will take you to Puerto Ayora. The guide will stop on the way to see the highlands, and giant land tortoises. You can enjoy the views and have lunch here. After lunch, you'll continue the transfer back to your hotel. The guide will bring you to Tortuga Bay in the afternoon. You walk through a cactus path for about 45 minutes to reach the first beach. It is known as Playa Brava because of its strong currents. You will see many marine iguanas and marine birds on this beach. We continue our walk for 15 minutes after visiting Playa Brava to reach Playa Mansa. The second beach, Playa Mansa, is surrounded by wetlands frequented by pelicans and blue-footed boobies. This is a great place to relax and swim. The distance you walk to get back to your hotel to eat and stay is the same. It is important that you choose a flight early enough to arrive at Baltra by 10am. Meals Included: Lunch / Dinner

Navigation (Bartolome, North Seymour or Santa Fe) Today, we will only be visiting one island. The tour begins after breakfast when the guide meets you at your hotel to start the tour. The yacht is equipped with a small, comfortable lunch. Return to the port after our tour concludes in the afternoon. North Seymour Island offers a beautiful place for hiking and snorkeling. The main attractions include: boobies (also known as booby birds), gulls (also called hawks), green sea turtles, and the famous Galapagos Sharks. Bartolome Island, too, is the most beautiful island in the archipelago. It is the most photographed island in the Galapagos Islands. Two beautiful bays, as well as fascinating volcanic cones and lava formations can be seen. Two islands form Plazas. The contrast between the turquoise water and the black lava, white sand is an excellent place to observe marine life. The coasts are the perfect place for snorkeling. Santa Fe Island, also known as Barrington Island, after Samuel Barrington is a small island of 24 square kilometers (9.3 square miles) in the Galapagos Archipelago. It lies to the south-east of Santa Cruz Island. It is also one of the oldest geologically, as volcanic rocks dating back to 4 million years have been discovered. The island's vegetation is characterized by brush and palo santo, as well as stands of a variety of prickly pears cactus Opuntia echios. We will then return to our hotel for dinner and accommodation. The island will be selected based on the available space Meals Included: Breakfast / Lunch / Dinner

Santa Cruz - Baltra Charles Station is visited in the early morning. You will be able to see different species of Tortoises. You will learn and hear about the conservation efforts aimed at protecting the Giant, as well as the entire archipelago. The guide and you will then take the road to the airport. This takes about an hour. You will then take a flight to Quito, or Guayaquil. It is important that you choose a flight departing Baltra no earlier than 11am to execute this itinerary. Meals Included: Breakfast
